snippet: Modern celebrations of World Series wins have a lack of spontaneity, with security preventing fans from going on the field and interviews conducted on a stage.
abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column notes that modern celebrations of World Series wins have a lack of spontaneity, with security preventing fans from going on the field and interviews conducted on a stage; holds that Fox Sports should have looked more deeply into its stable of announcers for a true baseball personality to cover postgame event of Boston Red Sox championship.
lead_paragraph: Modern celebrations of World Series wins have a lack of spontaneity, with security preventing fans from going on the field and interviews conducted on a stage.

headline.print_headline: On Fox, a Sterile End to a Series
headline.main: On Fox, a Sterile End to a Series
